input.content:
# Path to your oh-my-zsh installation
export ZSH="$HOME/.oh-my-zsh"

# Set theme - robbyrussell is the default, but you can change it
# See https://github.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/wiki/Themes
ZSH_THEME="robbyrussell"

# Uncomment the following line to use case-sensitive completion
# CASE_SENSITIVE="true"

# Uncomment the following line to use hyphen-insensitive completion
# Case-sensitive completion must be off. _ and - will be interchangeable
# HYPHEN_INSENSITIVE="true"

# Uncomment the following line if you want to disable marking untracked files
# under VCS as dirty. This makes repository status check for large repositories
# much, much faster
# DISABLE_UNTRACKED_FILES_DIRTY="true"

# Which plugins would you like to load?
# Standard plugins can be found in $ZSH/plugins/
# Custom plugins may be added to $ZSH_CUSTOM/plugins/
# Example format: plugins=(rails git textmate ruby lighthouse)
# Add wisely, as too many plugins slow down shell startup
plugins=(
    git
    zsh-autosuggestions
    zsh-syntax-highlighting
    docker
    docker-compose
    kubectl
    npm
    python
    pip
    command-not-found
    colored-man-pages
    extract
)

# Load oh-my-zsh
source $ZSH/oh-my-zsh.sh

# User configuration

# Export PATH
# export PATH="$HOME/bin:/usr/local/bin:$PATH"

# Set your preferred editor
export EDITOR='vim'

# Compilation flags
# export ARCHFLAGS="-arch x86_64"

# Set personal aliases
# For a full list of active aliases, run `alias`
alias ll='ls -alF'
alias la='ls -A'
alias l='ls -CF'
alias gs='git status'
alias gp='git pull'
alias gc='git commit'
alias gco='git checkout'
alias gb='git branch'
alias gd='git diff'
alias ga='git add'

# Enable color support of ls
if [ -x /usr/bin/dircolors ]; then
    test -r ~/.dircolors && eval "$(dircolors -b ~/.dircolors)" || eval "$(dircolors -b)"
    alias ls='ls --color=auto'
    alias grep='grep --color=auto'
    alias fgrep='fgrep --color=auto'
    alias egrep='egrep --color=auto'
fi

# History configuration
HISTFILE=~/.zsh_history
HISTSIZE=10000
SAVEHIST=10000
setopt EXTENDED_HISTORY
setopt HIST_EXPIRE_DUPS_FIRST
setopt HIST_IGNORE_DUPS
setopt HIST_IGNORE_SPACE
setopt HIST_VERIFY
setopt SHARE_HISTORY

# Key bindings
bindkey -e  # Use emacs key bindings

# Auto-completion
autoload -Uz compinit
compinit

# Enable advanced tab completion
zstyle ':completion:*' menu select
zstyle ':completion:*' matcher-list 'm:{a-zA-Z}={A-Za-z}'
zstyle ':completion:*' list-colors "${(s.:.)LS_COLORS}"

# Directory navigation
setopt AUTO_CD
setopt AUTO_PUSHD
setopt PUSHD_IGNORE_DUPS
setopt PUSHD_SILENT

# Prompt command substitution
setopt PROMPT_SUBST

# Add any custom PATH modifications here
# export PATH="$PATH:$HOME/.local/bin"

# Load any local configuration if it exists
[ -f ~/.zshrc.local ] && source ~/.zshrc.local

 **Advanced tab completion** with case-insensitive matching
 **Directory navigation** improvements (auto-cd, directory stack)

To activate the new configuration, run:
```bash
rcup
source ~/.zshrc
```

The configuration is clean and focused on essential features. You can customize the theme by changing `ZSH_THEME` or add more plugins as needed.

toolUseResult.originalFileContents:
# Path to your oh-my-zsh installation
export ZSH="$HOME/.oh-my-zsh"

# Set theme - robbyrussell is the default, but you can change it
# See https://github.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/wiki/Themes
ZSH_THEME="robbyrussell"

# Uncomment the following line to use case-sensitive completion
# CASE_SENSITIVE="true"

# Uncomment the following line to use hyphen-insensitive completion
# Case-sensitive completion must be off. _ and - will be interchangeable
# HYPHEN_INSENSITIVE="true"

# Uncomment the following line if you want to disable marking untracked files
# under VCS as dirty. This makes repository status check for large repositories
# much, much faster
# DISABLE_UNTRACKED_FILES_DIRTY="true"

# Which plugins would you like to load?
# Standard plugins can be found in $ZSH/plugins/
# Custom plugins may be added to $ZSH_CUSTOM/plugins/
# Example format: plugins=(rails git textmate ruby lighthouse)
# Add wisely, as too many plugins slow down shell startup
plugins=(
    git
    zsh-autosuggestions
    zsh-syntax-highlighting
    colored-man-pages
    extract
)

# Load oh-my-zsh
source $ZSH/oh-my-zsh.sh

# User configuration

# Export PATH
# export PATH="$HOME/bin:/usr/local/bin:$PATH"

# Set your preferred editor
export EDITOR='vim'

# Compilation flags
# export ARCHFLAGS="-arch x86_64"

# Set personal aliases
# For a full list of active aliases, run `alias`
alias ll='ls -alF'
alias la='ls -A'
alias l='ls -CF'
alias gs='git status'
alias gp='git pull'
alias gc='git commit'
alias gco='git checkout'
alias gb='git branch'
alias gd='git diff'
alias ga='git add'

# Enable color support of ls
if [ -x /usr/bin/dircolors ]; then
    test -r ~/.dircolors && eval "$(dircolors -b ~/.dircolors)" || eval "$(dircolors -b)"
    alias ls='ls --color=auto'
    alias grep='grep --color=auto'
    alias fgrep='fgrep --color=auto'
    alias egrep='egrep --color=auto'
fi

# History configuration
HISTFILE=~/.zsh_history
HISTSIZE=10000
SAVEHIST=10000
setopt EXTENDED_HISTORY
setopt HIST_EXPIRE_DUPS_FIRST
setopt HIST_IGNORE_DUPS
setopt HIST_IGNORE_SPACE
setopt HIST_VERIFY
setopt SHARE_HISTORY

# Key bindings
bindkey -e  # Use emacs key bindings

# Auto-completion
autoload -Uz compinit
compinit

# Enable advanced tab completion
zstyle ':completion:*' menu select
zstyle ':completion:*' matcher-list 'm:{a-zA-Z}={A-Za-z}'
zstyle ':completion:*' list-colors "${(s.:.)LS_COLORS}"

# Directory navigation
setopt AUTO_CD
setopt AUTO_PUSHD
setopt PUSHD_IGNORE_DUPS
setopt PUSHD_SILENT

# Prompt command substitution
setopt PROMPT_SUBST

# Add any custom PATH modifications here
# export PATH="$PATH:$HOME/.local/bin"

# Load any local configuration if it exists
[ -f ~/.zshrc.local ] && source ~/.zshrc.local

 **Extended Oh-My-Zsh plugins**: vi-mode, direnv, virtualenv, pyenv, z, uv, npm, nvm, zsh-navigation-tools
 **Development tool paths**: cargo, dotnet, opencode, lmstudio, pnpm
 **External integrations**: 
  - aichat shell integration with Alt+E keybinding
  - argc-completions for enhanced CLI completions
  - zsh-navigation-tools
 **Arch Linux aliases**: update, cleanup, pacman utilities
 **Productivity aliases**: lazygit, clipboard, config editing shortcuts
 **Build optimizations**: make and ninja with automatic core detection
 **skogcli integration**: Loads environment variables from your config system

The configuration intelligently checks for optional components before loading them, so it won't break if something is missing. It also preserves the ability to load local overrides via `~/.zshrc.local`.

To activate:
```bash
rcup
source ~/.zshrc
```

message.content: now what did you choose to not include?

content.text:
Looking at **zshrc-a**, here's what I deliberately **didn't include** and why:

## Excluded Features:

**1. Duplicate/Redundant Configuration:**
 **SKOGAI paths defined twice** (lines 2, 40-41, 150-151) - kept only one definition
 **SSH agent plugin** - commented out in original, likely using system ssh-agent

**2. Experimental/Commented Code:**
 **zplug plugin manager** (lines 162-246) - Large commented block, seems you moved away from it
 **Extensive completion customizations** (lines 227-244) - Commented out, redundant with Oh-My-Zsh

**3. Specific Tool Commands:**
 **`alias commit='aider --commit...'`** - Very specific aider command with hardcoded model
 **`alias gemini-cli="npx @google/gemini-cli"`** - Project-specific
 **`alias qwen='node /mnt/extra/...'`** - Hardcoded path to specific project
 **`alias fzf-pacman=...`** - Complex fzf command, might not have fzf installed

**4. Potentially Missing Dependencies:**
 **`source /usr/share/nvm/init-nvm.sh`** - System-specific nvm path
 **tailscale plugin** - Requires tailscale to be installed
 **ansible plugin** - Requires ansible

**5. Terminal Appearance:**
 **`LESS_TERMCAP_*` exports** (lines 116-117) - Terminal color codes for less pager
 **`ZSH_THEME="simple"`** - Kept robbyrussell as it's more feature-rich

**6. Security/Privacy:**
 **Direct sourcing of openrouter key** without the export (line 148)
 Left it as optional loading but didn't force the export

These exclusions keep the configuration cleaner and more portable. Most can be added to `~/.zshrc.local` if you need them for specific environments.

toolUseResult.originalFileContents:
#!/bin/zsh
# ============================================================================
# ZSH Configuration with Oh My Zsh
# Environment variables managed by: skogcli config
# ============================================================================

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Oh My Zsh Configuration
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
export ZSH="$HOME/.oh-my-zsh"
ZSH_THEME="robbyrussell"  # Change to 'simple' for minimal theme

CASE_SENSITIVE="false"
HYPHEN_INSENSITIVE="false"
DISABLE_MAGIC_FUNCTIONS="true"
ENABLE_CORRECTION="false"
# DISABLE_UNTRACKED_FILES_DIRTY="true"  # Uncomment for large repos

# Which plugins would you like to load?
# Standard plugins can be found in $ZSH/plugins/
# Custom plugins may be added to $ZSH_CUSTOM/plugins/
# Example format: plugins=(rails git textmate ruby lighthouse)
# Add wisely, as too many plugins slow down shell startup
plugins=(
    git
    zsh-autosuggestions
    zsh-syntax-highlighting
    colored-man-pages
    extract
    vi-mode
    direnv
    virtualenv
    pyenv
    z
    uv
    npm
    nvm
    zsh-navigation-tools
)

# Load oh-my-zsh
source $ZSH/oh-my-zsh.sh

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Environment Variables
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# SkogAI configuration
export SKOGAI="/home/skogix/skogai"
export SKOGAI_CONFIG_DIR="/home/skogix/skogai/config"

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# PATH Configuration
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# User binaries
export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$HOME/bin:$PATH"

# Development tools
export PATH="$HOME/.cargo/bin:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/.dotnet/tools:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/.opencode/bin:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/.lmstudio/bin:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/.local/share/pnpm:$PATH"

# External storage paths
export PATH="/mnt/extra/npm/global/bin:/mnt/extra/pnpm/global/bin:$PATH"

# Go binaries (fallback)
export PATH="$PATH:$GOPATH/bin" 2>/dev/null || true

# Set your preferred editor
export EDITOR='nvim'  # or 'vim' if you prefer

# Compilation flags
# export ARCHFLAGS="-arch x86_64"

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Aliases
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Navigation & Tools
alias ll='ls -alF'
alias la='ls -A'
alias l='ls -CF'
alias lg='lazygit'
alias c='clear'
alias open='xdg-open'

# Git shortcuts
alias gs='git status'
alias gp='git pull'
alias gc='git commit'
alias gco='git checkout'
alias gb='git branch'
alias gd='git diff'
alias ga='git add'

# Clipboard (Linux)
alias pbcopy='xclip -selection clipboard'
alias pbpaste='xclip -selection clipboard -o'

# Config editing
alias zshrc='nvim ~/.zshrc'
alias skenv='skogcli config list --env-only'
alias skadd='skogcli config add skogai.env.'

# System (Arch)
alias update='sudo pacman -Syu'
alias rmpkg='sudo pacman -Rsn'
alias cleanup='sudo pacman -Rsn $(pacman -Qtdq) 2>/dev/null || echo "No orphans"'
alias jctl='journalctl -p 3 -xb'
alias rip="expac --timefmt='%Y-%m-%d %T' '%l\t%n %v' | sort | tail -200 | nl"

# Build tools
alias make='make -j$(nproc)'
alias ninja='ninja -j$(nproc)'
alias n='ninja'

# Enable color support of ls
if [ -x /usr/bin/dircolors ]; then
    test -r ~/.dircolors && eval "$(dircolors -b ~/.dircolors)" || eval "$(dircolors -b)"
    alias ls='ls --color=auto'
    alias grep='grep --color=auto'
    alias fgrep='fgrep --color=auto'
    alias egrep='egrep --color=auto'
fi

# History configuration
HISTFILE=~/.zsh_history
HISTSIZE=10000
SAVEHIST=10000
setopt EXTENDED_HISTORY
setopt HIST_EXPIRE_DUPS_FIRST
setopt HIST_IGNORE_DUPS
setopt HIST_IGNORE_SPACE
setopt HIST_VERIFY
setopt SHARE_HISTORY

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Key Bindings
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
bindkey -e  # Use emacs key bindings
bindkey "^P" up-line-or-search

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Completions
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Custom completions directories
fpath+=~/.zsh-completions
fpath+=~/.zsh-completions/completions

# Initialize completions
autoload -Uz compinit
compinit

# Enable advanced tab completion
zstyle ':completion:*' menu select
zstyle ':completion:*' matcher-list 'm:{a-zA-Z}={A-Za-z}'
zstyle ':completion:*' list-colors "${(s.:.)LS_COLORS}"

# Directory navigation
setopt AUTO_CD
setopt AUTO_PUSHD
setopt PUSHD_IGNORE_DUPS
setopt PUSHD_SILENT

# Prompt command substitution
setopt PROMPT_SUBST

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# External Integrations
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# aichat shell integration (if available)
[ -f "$HOME/.local/src/aichat/scripts/shell-integration/integration.zsh" ] && \
    source "$HOME/.local/src/aichat/scripts/shell-integration/integration.zsh"

# ZSH Navigation Tools
[ -f "$HOME/.config/znt/zsh-navigation-tools/zsh-navigation-tools.plugin.zsh" ] && \
    source "$HOME/.config/znt/zsh-navigation-tools/zsh-navigation-tools.plugin.zsh"

# argc-completions setup
if [ -d "$HOME/.local/src/argc-completions" ]; then
    export ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT="$HOME/.local/src/argc-completions"
    export ARGC_COMPLETIONS_PATH="$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/completions/linux:$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/completions"
    export PATH="$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/bin:$PATH"
    # Generate completion scripts list
    argc_scripts=( $(ls -p -1 "$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/completions/linux" "$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/completions" 2>/dev/null | sed -n 's/\.sh$//p') )
    # Source argc completions
    [ -n "$argc_scripts" ] && source <(argc --argc-completions zsh $argc_scripts)
fi

# aichat keybinding (Alt+E)
_aichat_zsh() {
    if [[ -n "$BUFFER" ]]; then
        local _old=$BUFFER
        BUFFER+=""
        zle -I && zle redisplay
        BUFFER=$(aichat -e "$_old")
        zle end-of-line
    fi
}
zle -N _aichat_zsh
bindkey '\ee' _aichat_zsh

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Load Environment Variables from skogcli
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Loads all environment variables managed by skogcli
# To add: skogcli config add skogai.env.VAR_NAME "value"
# To list: skogcli config list --env-only
if command -v skogcli >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    eval "$(skogcli config export-env --namespace skogai,uv)"
fi

# Load OpenRouter API key (if exists)
[ -f "$HOME/.ssh/openrouter" ] && source "$HOME/.ssh/openrouter"

# Load local configuration if it exists
[ -f ~/.zshrc.local ] && source ~/.zshrc.local

export EDITOR='nvim'  # or 'vim' if you prefer

\ No newline at end of file

message.content: how did you choose to install the extra plugins/

content.text:
Looking at how I installed the plugins earlier, I used **git clone** to install them directly into the Oh-My-Zsh custom plugins directory:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-autosuggestions ${ZSH_CUSTOM:-~/.oh-my-zsh/custom}/plugins/zsh-autosuggestions
git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-syntax-highlighting.git ${ZSH_CUSTOM:-~/.oh-my-zsh/custom}/plugins/zsh-syntax-highlighting
```

This is the **standard Oh-My-Zsh method** for third-party plugins - they go in `~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins/`.

However, I notice you've now **enabled ssh-agent** (line 39), but the other plugins I added to the config are a mix of:

**Built-in Oh-My-Zsh plugins** (already installed):
 `git`, `colored-man-pages`, `extract`, `vi-mode`, `direnv`, `virtualenv`, `pyenv`, `z`, `npm`, `nvm`, `ssh-agent`

**Custom/third-party plugins** (need installation):
 `zsh-autosuggestions`  (already installed)
 `zsh-syntax-highlighting`  (already installed) 
 `zsh-navigation-tools` - This one might need special handling
 `uv` - Might not exist as an official plugin

The plugins like `tailscale` and `ansible` that are commented out would just need to be uncommented - they're built into Oh-My-Zsh and don't require separate installation.

**Alternative approaches** I didn't use but you have in comments:
 **zplug** - Plugin manager that can handle GitHub repos, binaries, Oh-My-Zsh plugins all in one place
 **Manual fpath** - Adding completion directories directly to fpath

Would you like me to check which of the enabled plugins actually exist and work?
